look into apt-cacher.  that's what I use to only download each package once
each of my computers points to the 'server' in its sources.list, and the server caches the .deb files, so each one is only downloaded once
and what if i copy by my hand packages...deb packages are i386...they work with ever arch...
some .deb files are arch-independant.  some aren't
apt-cacher will take care of that for you
i'll copy packages and apt-get will download package dependant only...it's the same
if the package name has _i386.deb at the end, it's Intel.  if it has _all.deb, it's independent
